intro: Rhinanthus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, often in association with other wildflowers. Rhinanthus pubescens plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
